repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio de Janeiro Metropolitan Urban
            and Housing Development Policy Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rio de Janeiro
            Metropolitan Urban and Housing Development Policy Loan
            Project for Brazil were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate,
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the operation capitalized on the
            heightened desired for enhancing investment coordination at
            the metropolitan level given the flow of investments being
            channeled into the Metropolitan Region of Rio de Janeiro
            (RJMR) as a result of the upcoming summer olympics, the
            soccer world cup, and the ongoing industrial restructuring
            of the region, fueled partly by the recent discovery of oil
            reserves. These circumstantial events play a determinant
            role in the relevance and effectiveness of lending
            operations. Strong institutional leadership and
            implementation capacity were key determinants of the level
            of achievement across the various policy areas. Strong
            leadership from top Government of the State of Rio de
            Janeiro (GoRJ) authorities will be required to effectively
            align priorities within the government with the goals set
            for the operation. Ensuring the non-reversibility of tranche
            release conditions poses a difficult challenge. Regional
            development interventions, require engaging with multiple
            government agencies, the implementation experience of this
            operation illustrates the difficulties of working with
            agencies that present uneven levels of institutional
            maturity, technical competency, and leadership. Metropolitan
            development operations require working with municipal, as
            well as federal entities and programs, and add further
            complexity. Delays in the preparation of the Technical
            Assistance Loan (TAL) operation resulted in the lack of
            adequate technical support for the institutional
            restructuring activities that were envisioned under this
            Development Policy Loan (DPL). While the team labored to
            secure other TA support through trust funds, including
            South-South exchanges, the void left by the TAL operation
            substantially hindered the overall effectiveness of this
            DPL. The experience of this operation underlines how the
            effectiveness of a DPL can be enhanced by a TA instrument in
            a low institutional capacity environment. Sub-national
            operations offer great potential for cross-fertilization and
            economies of scale. There are often trade-offs between
            defining a thematically consistent policy matrix and
            maximizing the accountability of implementing agencies.

docna.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio de Janeiro Metropolitan Urban
            and Housing Development Policy Loan Project

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio de Janeiro Metropolitan Urban
            and Housing Development Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rio de Janeiro
            Metropolitan Urban and Housing Development Program is to
            support the State Government of Rio de Janeiro (GORJ) to
            strengthen its policies for planning and managing
            territorial growth in the Rio de Janeiro Metropolitan
            Region, promoting the provision of affordable housing, and
            creating integrated social development programs targeted at
            the urban poor. The State of Rio de Janeiro (RJ) is the
            third largest in Brazil. The Metropolitan Region of Rio de
            Janeiro (RMRJ), with a population of 12 million, is the
            nation's second largest metropolitan area. As the
            historical capital and a major tourism destination, the RMRJ
            has special significance for Brazil. The region's
            economy and urban growth have suffered considerably since
            the 1970s as a result of the relocation of the capital to
            Brasilia, as well as industrial restructuring, and social
            problems. Rio's share of the country's population
            and Gross Domestic Product (GDP) declined between 1970 and
            2001. However, growth has recovered significantly in recent
            years, and the RMRJ has entered into a new era of
            development, supported by new industrial poles and the
            opportunities provided by being the host city of mega-events
            such as the 2016 Summer Olympic Games and the 2014 World Cup.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio de Janeiro Metropolitan Urban
            and Housing Development Policy Loan : summary of discussion

abstracts.cdata!:
The Executive Directors approved a
            two-tranche Development Policy Loan (DPL) to the State of
            Rio de Janerio in the amount of US$485 million with a
            sovereign guarantee from the Federative Republic of Brazil
            for the Rio de Janerio metropolitan urban and housing DPL on
            the payment terms and conditions set out in the
            President's Memorandum (R2011-0041).

            and Housing Development Policy Loan : summary of discussion
